name: Houlton Band of Maliseet Indians Health and Wellness Center
description: This tribal government healthcare organization offers outpatient treatment for substance use disorders, including cognitive behavioral therapy, motivational interviewing, and relapse prevention. They also provide recovery support services such as housing assistance and discharge planning
services: American-Indian-owned Rehabilitation services in Maine consultation

name: Wabanaki Public Health and Wellness (Multiple Locations)
address: Various locations including Bangor and Millinocket. Specific addresses for individual facilities are listed below
description: Wabanaki Public Health and Wellness provides culturally sensitive healthcare and social services to the Wabanaki Nations in Maine. They operate several facilities focused on substance use disorder treatment and recovery
services: American-Indian-owned Rehabilitation services in Maine consultation

name: Cedar Road Detox and MAT (part of Wabanaki Public Health & Wellness)
address: 68 Mount Hope Avenue, Suite 2, Bangor, ME
description: Offers culturally centered residential detox and outpatient addiction treatment for Indigenous and non-Indigenous adults with opioid, alcohol, and stimulant use disorders. Services include MAT, counseling, and recovery coaching
services: American-Indian-owned Rehabilitation services in Maine consultation

name: Opportunity House (part of Wabanaki Recovery Homes)
description: An 8-bed recovery home for Indigenous men, providing a safe, substance-free, and culturally healing living environment
services: American-Indian-owned Rehabilitation services in Maine consultation

name: Wabanaki Women's Home (part of Wabanaki Recovery Homes)
address: Bangor, ME (Specific address not publicly listed)
description: An 8-bed recovery home for Indigenous women, offering a safe and culturally supportive environment for recovery
services: American-Indian-owned Rehabilitation services in Maine consultation

name: Healing House (part of Wabanaki Recovery Homes)
address: Millinocket, ME (Adjacent to The Healing Lodge)
description: A recovery residence tied to The Healing Lodge, serving individuals receiving care at Wabanaki facilities in Millinocket. It can accommodate 8 individuals
services: American-Indian-owned Rehabilitation services in Maine consultation

name: Penobscot Indian Health Center
address: (Specific address not readily available for rehabilitation services, but the general health center is located in Maine)
phone: (207) 853-0644 (for Pleasant Point Health Center, which may have related services)
description: This center, part of the Indian Health Service (IHS) network, provides health services to American Indians and Alaska Natives. They may offer or coordinate rehabilitation and substance abuse treatment services, often accepting IHS/Tribal/Urban (ITU) funds
services: American-Indian-owned Rehabilitation services in Maine consultation

name: Wabanaki Vocational Rehabilitation Program
description: This program provides vocational assessment, training, career counseling, and job placement assistance for American Indians with disabilities in Maine, helping them to enter or maintain employment
services: American-Indian-owned Rehabilitation services in Maine consultation
